title: Brand Manager

pay_input_ranges.title: Salary Range
pay_input_ranges.blurb:
What We Offer

Benefits

  • Excellent, full coverage medical, dental, and vision insurance with employer-paid HRA
  • Generous PTO and 15 company-wide holidays
  • 401k with company contribution
  • Paid parental leave
  • Work-life balance with an emphasis on personal well-being
  • Career growth in a disruptor space & entrepreneurial opportunities within the Media.Monks network 
  • A globally diverse & inclusive culture with employee resource groups such as S4 Melanin, Pride.Monks, Cultura.Monks, and more!
  • Authentic commitment to DEI efforts and sustainable growth. (Why Sir Martin Sorrell signed The Climate Pledge here!)

 

 

Media.Monks has provided a compensation range that represents its good faith estimate of what Media.Monks may pay for the position at the time of posting. Media.Monks may ultimately pay more or less than the posted compensation range. The salary offered to the selected candidate will be determined based on job-related factors, but not based on a candidate’s sex or any other protected status.

content:
About the job
We are looking for an embedded role for one of our entertainment clients. This employee will be responsible for bridging the gap between the client and agency through planning and tracking of campaign creative and related marketing projects from inception to completion. The position reports to the Creative Strategy Team Lead and will be a critical member of the team leading creative development and measurement across biddable media channels for driving Subscriber Acquisition.
You will build relationships with partnering brand manager clients, championing the Decoded creative learning process, and driving learnings through each project. You will be encouraged and expected to be intimately familiar with the brand, product, market conditions and competitors. 
This role will partner with the client's creative strategy team, alongside Decoded Brand, Strategy, and Analytics, teams at Decoded: 
QUALIFICATIONS + QUALITIES

4-5 years of marketing experience, preferably in media or creative management
Bachelor's degree. Preferably in Business, Marketing, Advertising, Communications, or related field
General understanding of paid media and direct response campaigns; as well as general ad operations knowledge and experience with asset tagging and trafficking (i.e. via DCM)
Experience with marketing creative production (from conception to asset production and delivery) and an understanding of how to apply data and analytics to help guide creative choices that optimize creative performance 
Demonstrated ability to prioritize, meet deadlines, make decisions and change course of action quickly
Exceptional organizational skills and ability to manage accountability well across multiple work streams in a dynamic, highly charged environment 
Highly collaborative creative sensibility, with ability to be open minded to feedback and always seeking out the best idea, not just their own idea
Keen eye for detail and strong interpersonal skills, with an ability to direct agencies and internal teams in a proactive, productive and positive manner

Nice to haves:

Entertainment industry experience, either in-house or at an agency
Experience with Airtable or other project management tools.
Familiarity with design software (i.e. Photoshop, AfterEffects & Premiere)

RESPONSIBILITIES

Support daily operations for Creative Strategy team through various campaign management duties needed across performance media channels
Develop and maintain materials and documents used to support alignment of cross-channel strategies and campaign creative (ex: Campaign Priorities Calendar, Flex Creative Playbook, etc)
Assist in development of all creative requests, approvals timelines and final delivery (gathering asset production needs, assisting in timely creative reviews and feedback, tracking against key deadlines and milestones, etc)
Maintain all workback schedules for creative production and work through any bottlenecks while communicating any delays to the respective creative and trafficking teams  
Partner with team members and agency partners to pull reports and aggregate insights
Facilitate monthly audits between the client and Decoded’s strategy teams to ensure all creative in market is up-to-date 
Partner with Ad Ops and Media teams for seamless trafficking and campaign launch across channels
Act as the main point of contact for any trafficking or creative issues 
Create, update and monitor all creative tickets in the client’s AirTable project management platform
Work cross-functionally with the client’s data and analytics teams to ensure all creative rotations are being communicated across media channels and leads 
Assist in conceptualization and execution of team’s creative testing roadmap when needed

WHY DECODED

We are one of the fastest growing agencies in the US
Amazing clients from Fortune 100 household brands to disruptive start-ups
This role offers a highly unique learning and development opportunity
Our company is profitable & established. A “startup culture” without “startup anxiety.”
We encourage creative thinking and independent responsibilities

OUR BENEFITS AND PERK OFFERINGS:

Competitive Salaries
100% employer-paid medical, dental, and vision insurance for employee and dependent(s)
3% 401k employer match from the start
Unlimited PTO and Summer Fridays
Career Training and learning opportunities
Generous Fully Paid Parental leave
Relaxed Flexible Hybrid working environment

Compensation
The anticipated salary range for this position is $75,000- $85,000 annually. Salary is determined by a combination of factors that include relevant experience, knowledge, skills, other job-related qualifications, and geography.
#LI-SD1 What We Offer
Benefits

Excellent, full coverage medical, dental, and vision insurance with employer-paid HRA
Generous PTO and 15 company-wide holidays
401k with company contribution
Paid parental leave
Work-life balance with an emphasis on personal well-being
Career growth in a disruptor space & entrepreneurial opportunities within the Media.Monks network 
A globally diverse & inclusive culture with employee resource groups such as S4 Melanin, Pride.Monks, Cultura.Monks, and more!
Authentic commitment to DEI efforts and sustainable growth. (Why Sir Martin Sorrell signed The Climate Pledge here!)

 
 
Media.Monks has provided a compensation range that represents its good faith estimate of what Media.Monks may pay for the position at the time of posting. Media.Monks may ultimately pay more or less than the posted compensation range. The salary offered to the selected candidate will be determined based on job-related factors, but not based on a candidate’s sex or any other protected status.
 Salary Range$85—$90 USDAbout Media.Monks:
Media.Monks is the purely digital operating brand of S4Capital plc that connects 8,600+ digital natives across one global team. We are united by a mission to shift industries forward and pave the path towards ambitious outcomes so our clients and our people can realize their full potential for growth. Our unified model combines solutions in media, data, social, platforms, studio, experience, brand and technology services to help our clients continuously reinvent themselves throughout increasingly rapid cycles of disruption. Our efforts to shape culture, build innovative technologies and unlock the future of growth have earned recognition from numerous esteemed panels: we maintain a constant presence on Adweek’s Fastest Growing lists (2019-22), regular recognition at Cannes Lions, inclusion in AdExchanger’s Programmatic Power Players (2020-23), the title of Webby Production Company of the Year (2021-23), a record number of FWAs, and have earned a spot on Newsweek’s Top 100 Global Most Loved Workplaces 2023. Together, these achievements solidify our experience in digital innovation, excellence in craft, and commitment to personal growth.
While we continue to grow our teams, please be mindful of fraudulent job postings and recruiting activities that may use our company name and information. Please be mindful to protect your personal information, especially your national identification number, and bank account information during a recruiting process. While Media.Monks may reach out to potential candidates via LinkedIn, we will always ask applicants to apply through our website (https://media.monks.com/careers) and will never ask for payment or bank account information during the recruitment process.

demographic_questions.description:
At Media.Monks, we believe in fostering an environment where a diversity of perspectives can thrive. We proactively work to design hiring processes that promote equity and inclusion while mitigating bias. We celebrate diversity and are committed to building a team that reflects the communities we serve. We welcome and encourage qualified applicants, from all backgrounds, who are excited to contribute to our mission. 

As a step in strengthening our hiring process, we invite you to voluntarily provide information that will help inform and improve our inclusion efforts.

As a reminder, answering this question is entirely voluntary. Your response will remain confidential and intended solely for the purpose of improving our hiring process; and will not, in any way, be associated with your specific application or be used in the hiring decision.

questions.label: Do you or will you require sponsorship for a US employment visa (e.g. H-1B)?
This position requires you to be located in Los Angeles, California. Are you willing to go into the LA office on an as needed/hybrid basis?
